intro: Tamonea praecox, commonly known as the early tamonea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves with a smooth surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Tamonea praecox is an herbaceous perennial that blooms in early spring, making it a notable species in its native habitats.
